TopicTitle: Show debris in map view in 0.20

Articles.Content:
I launched a full tank as the first part of my future station... But it has no command pod and is practically "debris"

But now when controling other ship, the tank doesn't show up on map screen cause it's... DEBRIS!! So I can't make it a target and randevouz with it. In 0.19 since all the debris showed up on map view, there was no problem catching debris, but now it's very difficult. The only way to do it is to approach it on luck and double click on it to target it..

Is there some switch that I am not aware of to turn debris on in map view?

Edited June 6, 2013 by nothke

Move the mouse up to the top center of the map screen (or click a small tab up there? can't remember), and a bar similar to the one in the tracking station will appear.

Click on the debris icon to show only debris

Right-click it to add it to the list of things being shown.
Put your cursor to place of altimeter while in map mode. It should open pop-up menu to select which types are shown.

Actually I meant the icon bar, not the debris, hiding debris is great. But why hide the icon bar???

You rarely need to use it, so for the most part it's just clutter.
Does anyone actually collect debris, and is there any point in recovering trash? I'd like to go clean up my orbit just so I can get good as rendezvous and "docking".

Yeah, there are some people who try to minimize orbital debris, and some of them send special missions to collect any debris left due to failure of whatever de-orbiting procedure they had in place. Solutions range from using laser mods to shoot down the debris to various grabber mechanisms, including some built entirely with stock parts.

Personally, I never bothered with these. The growing debris rings around planets and moons serves as reminder of my successes and failures.
The bar is always there in the tracking station, I guess for map view it's hidden to avoid clutter.
